episodes.title: CSH SCREENER: The Peoples Temple: Nov. 1978 - November 1980
episodes.description: LOW RESOLUTION SCREENER with TIMECODEUse the timecode at the top of the screen to mark in/out points when licencing master clips. Description: The Peoples Temple Agricultural Project, better known by its informal name "Jonestown", was a remote settlement in Guyana, South America, established by the Peoples Temple - an American cult under the leadership of Jim Jones. On November 18th, 1978 over 900 members would die under Jones' command while congressman Leo Ryan and others lay dead after being assassinated trying to leave the country.  These reels do not contain any footage of Jim Jones or the events at Jonestown.Some footage is silent. KCRA Specials 34L7-2 "Guyana"Contact Information Center for Sacramento History551 Sequoia Pacific Blvd, Sacramento, CA 95811Telephone: 916. 808. 7072, Email: csh@cityofsacramento.orghttp://www.centerforsacramentohistory.org/

episodes.title: CSH SCREENER: The Peoples Temple OUTTAKES Reels 1 - 3 November 1978
episodes.description: LOW RESOLUTION SCREENER with TIMECODEUse the timecode at the top of the screen to mark in/out points when licencing master clips. Description: The Peoples Temple Agricultural Project, better known by its informal name "Jonestown", was a remote settlement in Guyana, South America, established by the Peoples Temple - an American cult under the leadership of Jim Jones. On November 18th, 1978 over 900 members would die under Jones' command while congressman Leo Ryan and others lay dead after being assassinated trying to leave the country.  These three film reels, captured by KCRA-TV, are OUTTAKES of footage used for broadcast. They show those left behind in San Francisco, the families of those in Guyana wondering the fate of their loved ones, and the aftermath of such a horrific event. The Peoples Temple building in San Francisco is seen as well as interviews, press conferences, Tim Jones - Jim Jones' adopted son - and others help tell the story in the days following the Jonestown tragedy Featuring KCRA reporters Spencer Michaels, John Gibson, and others. These reels do not contain any footage of Jim Jones or the events at Jonestown.Some footage is silent. KCRA Specials 34L7-2 "Guyana"Contact Information Center for Sacramento History, 551 Sequoia Pacific Blvd, Sacramento, CA 95811, Telephone: 916. 808. 7072, Email: csh@cityofsacramento.org, http://www.centerforsacramentohistory.org/

episodes.title: CSH SCREENER: The Peoples Temple OUTTAKES Reels 1 - 3 November 1978
episodes.description: LOW RESOLUTION SCREENER with TIMECODEUse the timecode at the top of the screen to mark in/out points when licencing master clips. The Peoples Temple Agricultural Project, better known by its informal name "Jonestown", was a remote settlement in Guyana, South America, established by the Peoples Temple - an American cult under the leadership of Jim Jones. On November 18th, 1978 over 900 members would die under Jones' command while congressman Leo Ryan and others lay dead after being assassinated while trying to leave the country.  These three film reels, captured by KCRA-TV, are OUTTAKES of footage used for broadcast. They show those left behind in San Francisco, the families of those in Guyana wondering the fate of their loved ones, and the aftermath of such a horrific event. The Peoples Temple building in San Francisco is seen as well as interviews, press conferences, Tim Jones - Jim Jones' adopted son, and others help tell the story in the days following the Jonestown mass murder. Featuring KCRA reporters Spencer Michaels, John Gibson, and others. These reels do not contain any footage of Jim Jones or the events at Jonestown.Some footage is silent. KCRA Specials 34L7-2 "Guyana"Contact Information Center for Sacramento History, 551 Sequoia Pacific Blvd, Sacramento, CA 95811, Telephone: 916. 808. 7072, Email: csh@cityofsacramento.org, http://www.centerforsacramentohistory.org/
